abstract: A New York state court judge temporarily halted Wachovia’s efforts to abandon deal talks with Citigroup in favor of a merger with Wells Fargo, escalating the battle over the Charlotte-based banking giant.
snippet: A New York state court judge temporarily halted Wachovia’s efforts to abandon deal talks with Citigroup in favor of a merger with Wells Fargo, escalating the battle over the Charlotte-based banking giant.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup announced late Saturday that it had persuaded a New York judge to temporarily block Wells Fargo from acquiring Wachovia, firing the first shot in what could be a prolonged legal battle, The New York Times’s Eric Dash and Jonathan D. Glater reported.

headline.main: Judge Puts Temporary Halt on Wachovia-Wells Fargo Deal
